author: Nicolas Furno
title: Le vrai nouveau Siri, celui alimentÃ© par une IA gÃ©nÃ©rative, ne sortirait pas avantâ€¦ 2026
text: Le dÃ©ploiement dâ€™Apple Intelligence se fait par petites Ã©tapes, on le sait et on attend encore un dernier gros morceau dans quelques mois avec un Siri plus puissant, qui pourra piocher des informations personnelles pour offrir des rÃ©ponses plus utiles. MalgrÃ© tout, ce Siri ne sera pas aussi bavard et capable de rÃ©pondre Ã  nâ€™importe quelle question, comme on a pu le voir rÃ©cemment chez Google, Microsoft, Meta et OpenAI. Il sâ€™agit essentiellement de changements esthÃ©tiques, saupoudrÃ©s de quelques amÃ©liorations quand mÃªme, mais rien dâ€™aussi radical que ce que lâ€™on voit partout ailleurs. Dâ€™aprÃ¨s Mark Gurman , il faudra patienter pour dÃ©couvrir le Siri revu de fond en comble et basÃ© sur les intelligences artificielles gÃ©nÃ©ratives : Apple compterait le dÃ©voiler lors de la prochaine WWDC, en juin 2025, pour un lancement prÃ©vu avec iOS 19 et macOS 16. Comme pour les premiÃ¨res fonctionnalitÃ©s Apple Intelligence nÃ©anmoins, les sorties ne se feraient pas dâ€™un seul bloc dÃ¨s le mois de septembre, avec les premiÃ¨res versions finales de ces mises Ã  jour majeures. De fait, il faudrait attendre le printemps 2026 et probablement iOS 19.4 ainsi que macOS 16.4, pour enfin pouvoir utiliser ce que les concurrents dâ€™Apple proposent depuis dÃ©jÃ  plusieurs mois. Le journaliste de Bloomberg ne prÃ©cise pas si ce serait une sortie initialement limitÃ©e Ã  lâ€™anglais. Il note en revanche que le calendrier est encore susceptible dâ€™Ã©voluer, tant Apple semble encore loin du compte. Ce nouveau Siri devrait Ãªtre basÃ© sur un grand modÃ¨le de langage, comme Gemini Live, CoPilot Voice et tous les autres. Si les tests actuellement menÃ©s en interne se feraient sous la forme dâ€™une app dÃ©diÃ©e, lâ€™ambition serait bien de remplacer lâ€™assistant vocal qui a trouvÃ© place au cÅ“ur dâ€™iOS Ã  lâ€™automne 2011 par cette nouvelle gÃ©nÃ©ration. Avant de le faire, la Pomme devra sâ€™assurer que les fonctionnalitÃ©s actuelles de son assistant vocal sont maintenues, car câ€™est la plus grosse faiblesse des assistants nouvelle gÃ©nÃ©ration. Comme le rappelle cette vidÃ©o de Joanna Stern, sâ€™ils peuvent impressionner et Ãªtre vraiment utiles pour rÃ©pondre Ã  des questions en tout genre, ces nouveaux assistants ne sont pas capables de rÃ©aliser des tÃ¢ches aussi simples que dÃ©finir un minuteur. Pour le moment, Google fait ainsi coexister Gemini Live et Assistant pour offrir les deux options. Comme souvent, le plan dâ€™Apple serait plus ambitieux, puisque lâ€™on nâ€™aurait quâ€™un seul Siri, qui pourrait faire la conversation et vous donner des conseils sur lâ€™allumage dâ€™un feu, tout en pouvant lancer des minuteurs et ouvrir la porte du garage. MalgrÃ© tout, la perspective dâ€™une sortie dans un an et demi seulement, alors que lâ€™on a des assistants vocaux bien plus compÃ©tents en circulation aujourdâ€™hui, ne doit probablement rÃ©jouir personne Ã  Cupertino. Apple a beau se vanter de ne pas tant chercher Ã  Ãªtre la premiÃ¨re sur une technologie quâ€™Ãªtre la meilleure, les premiÃ¨res fonctionnalitÃ©s Apple Intelligence prouvent bien quâ€™elle nâ€™est pour lâ€™heure ni lâ€™une, ni lâ€™autre. En attendant et faute de mieux, Apple Intelligence fera une belle place Ã  ChatGPT dans la version finale dâ€™iOS 18.2, attendue dÃ¨s le mois prochain. Ce sera aussi la premiÃ¨re expansion hors des frontiÃ¨res amÃ©ricaines, mÃªme sâ€™il faudra attendre le printemps pour tester Apple Intelligence en Union europÃ©enne.

author: Matthew McQuaid
title: Dispensary 33 Budtenders Join Teamsters Local 777 - International Brotherhood of Teamsters
text:
(CHICAGO) â€“ Cannabis workers at Dispensary 33 have overwhelmingly chosen to join Teamsters Local 777.
â€œThis is another major step forward for cannabis workers in Illinois,â€ said Jim Glimco, President of Local 777. â€œThese budtenders came together, stood strong, and made their voices heard. Now we can get to the bargaining table faster and focus on securing the wages, benefits, and protections that these workers deserve.â€
Local 777 has led the way in organizing Illinois cannabis workers, securing contracts that include industry-leading wages, protections against unjust discipline, and safety improvements. This recent victory adds to the Teamstersâ€™ growing presence in the industry.
â€œCannabis workers nationwide are realizing the power of Teamsters representation,â€ said Jesse Case, Director of the Teamsters Food Processing Division. â€œWeâ€™ve already organized workers from coast to coast. This isnâ€™t just a trend â€” itâ€™s a movement thatâ€™s transforming the cannabis industry for the better.â€
â€œWorking with such thoughtful, capable, compassionate people during this campaign has shown me what true community can feel like,â€ said Finn Allen, a budtender at Dispensary 33. â€œThe organizing process has only made us a stronger, more collaborative unit, and we are so ready to fight for the workplace that we deserve.â€ Founded in 1937, Teamsters Local 777 represents workers in a wide variety of industries throughout the Chicago area. For more information, go to https://www.teamsters777.org/

author: mediapost.com
title: Pitching Pouches: Group Charges That Publishers Are Promoting Tobacco To Youth 12/20/2024
text:
by Ray Schultz , Columnist, 4 hours ago
Yet another form of trouble may be looming for some publishers. Two are being called out for allegedly carrying ads for nicotine: Hearst Communications Inc. and CondÃ© Nast.
A group that includes the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids and 50 public health advocates in 10 countries demand that Hearst and CondÃ© Nast stop promoting tobacco and nicotine products to kids online.
Specifically, they charge that Seventeen, Cosmopolitan, Vogue and Glamour are partnering with Philip Morris International to promote IQOS heated cigarette and Zyn nicotine pouch products to young people under the age of 25.
"It is absolutely outrageous that magazines like Seventeen are helping one of the world's largest tobacco companies reach teens and young adults online," says Smita Baruah, executive vice president of global tobacco control at the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids. "By allowing Philip Morris to advertise IQOS and Zyn through popular lifestyle magazines, Hearst and CondÃ© Nast are exposing their readers to harmful and addictive products meant to hook to a new generation."
advertisement
advertisement
Hearst says that the Seventeen ad was the result of an error.
The group and five other organizations sent letters to the publishers asking them to cease and desist earlier this year.
The letters charge that CondÃ© Nast and Hearst are helping Philip Morris skirt a Meta ban on tobacco advertising while undermining advertising laws in at least one country.
Moreover, these promotions have been published online in Spain, Eastern Europe, Mexico, Latin America and the United States. Worse yet, paid advertisements for Zyn, an addictive nicotine pouch, were paired with articles such as "34 Best Gifts for Teenage Girls" and "Best Christmas Movies for Teens," on websites for Seventeen and Cosmopolitan , the group claims.
A Hearst spokesperson provided this comment: " The Seventeen ad was an operational error that was immediately corrected upon discovery in the spring. We do not accept advertising for nicotine, tobacco or vaping products on Seventeen and we have an extra layer of targeting across our brand sites in the U.S. to ensure that we are not reaching anyone under 21 with this type of advertising."
As non-tobacco users, we have no comment on the products or the purported promotions except to note the claim that IQOS is safer than regular cigarettes.
However, this is not a new issue.
As historians have documented, cigarette merchants achieved their biggest boost to prosperity with the development of mass production and then mass advertising. By the mid-1920s, brand names like Lucky Strike and Camel were plastered on billboards and on the pages of magazines.
These depicted smoking as an attractive pastime, and linked it to sporting activities and romance.
As time went on, the manufacturers aimed their advertising at young non-smokers instead of people who were already hooked, opening up a whole new market. They also targeted women. And they sent thousands of free cartons to veteransâ€™ hospitals and servicemen stationed overseas, gaining praiseâ€”and probably new customers.
Their typical stance could be found in this ad headline: â€œNot a Cough in a Carload.â€
Things have changed since then. Non-smokers are no longer bothered by a thick haze of cigarette smoke in movie theaters and restaurants. But there are other types of tobacco products, including those mentioned here. The dangers are not yet clear.

author: Shawn Johnson
title: Canada will stand with Ukraine in protest against Russian aggression, says Deputy Prime Minister
text:
Deputy Prime Minister Chrystia Freeland said Ukraine can count on further unwavering support from Canada.
â€œThe brave people of Ukraine are fighting for their democracy and freedom â€“ but they are also on the front lines fighting for all of us. â€œCanadians will stand with Ukraine in protesting against Russiaâ€™s illegal aggression.â€ Freeland wrote on X.
The brave people of Ukraine are fighting for their democracy and freedom â€“ but they are also on the front lines fighting for all of us. Canadians will stand with Ukraine in protest against Russia's illegal aggression.
[pic.twitter.com/6HOwo1YewM]
â€“ Chrystia Freeland (@cafreeland)
[19 January 2024]
Canada has long been a supporter of Ukraine as the country continues to fight Russian aggression. According to the Fall 2023 Economic Statement, Canada plans to allocate more than $940 billion in aid to Ukraine by 2026. The Canadian government will send $595 million to Ukraine in 2023-2024, $232 million in 2024-2025, and more than $143 million in 2025-2026.
This statement of the Canadian Deputy Prime Minister came after a meeting with Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba. The two sides discussed the implementation of mechanisms to use frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine.
â€œDuring our meeting, the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance of Canada @cafreeland And I focused on the use of frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine.
It is the morally, politically and legally right thing to do. â€œThe G7 and the EU must act collectively and swiftly.â€ Kuleba said on x.
Canada's Deputy PM and Finance Minister during our meeting
[@caffreyland]And I focused on the use of frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine.
It is the morally, politically and legally right thing to do.
Action must be taken collectively and swiftly by the G7 and the EU.
[pic.twitter.com/beyMB5Ob02]
â€“ Dmytro Kuleba (@DmytroKuleba)
[18 January 2024]
In late April 2022, the US House of Representatives approved a bill on freezing frozen assets owned by Russian sanctioned entities and individuals. The seized funds were proposed to be directed to providing additional military and humanitarian assistance to Ukraine.
In December 2023, the US proposed a plan to its G7 allies to freeze $300 billion in Russian assets. In return, Russia condemned the freeze as a violation of basic principles of reserve security and hired international law firms and expert opinions to defend its interests in the courts.
